metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8723 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The AirPDcapPacketProcess function in epan/crypt/airpdcap.c in the 802.11 dissector in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.9 and 2.0.x before 2.0.1 does not validate the relationship between the total length and the capture length, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer overflow and application crash) via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwireshark5 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwiretap4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwsutil4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1').
